DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time at which the imaging agent was injected: recorded in military time format, e.g. 1:00 pm = 1300 hrs.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The location where a syringe containing a substance (such as a radioisotope) used in a computerized image of the metabolic activity of body tissues entered the body.  [Manually-curated]_Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Substances having the same number of protons in their nuclei and hence having the same atomic number, but differing in the number of neutrons and therefore, in the mass number.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A form of a chemical element containing a specific number of neutrons and a specific atomic mass.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  10/2/07- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The point at the beginning of time (recorded in military format) when fluids or drugs are push into the body via use of a syringe and needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.":Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/14/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent PET modality CSI. jc  3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  2/26/08 revised max/min to 4/4 to harmonize with other military time VDs for ACRIN PET CDEs.  12/20/07 revised to remove radiotracer which is captured in DEC.  10/3/07 - created to support ACRIN PET CDE curation

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  6/30/11 - added 6671-TA alt question text--- Curated to support U Washington adoption of C3D for FES trial.
